title: As the waters rise again in Tewkesbury, I know what it's like to have your family home flooded
text:
When an angry torrent of thick brown water engulfed our home, my son’s first reaction – clad in a tartan dressing gown, but otherwise indistinguishable from Shakespeare’s Caesar on the shores of the Tiber – was to rescue a pack of Mini Cheddars from the kitchen. I was about to berate him when my wife Helen called. Why was there a lake the size of a park outside our house, she asked.

The first I saw of it was from the bedroom window. A steady stream of water was running down our road, first keeping to the gutters, then spreading the full length of the street, trapping commuters on little pavement islands. Showing true British grit, at least one rolled up his trousers and waded off.
